group_1.textLeft: So you didn't understand the vampire correctly,@then...
But how is it possible for the author to@misunderstand their own character's personality?

group_1.textRight: To be exact, I didn't write this character from@scratch...
She's based on an already existing character...

group_1.textLeft: Unless my memory is betraying me, that is the@name of your favorite shoujo manga, yes?
Handling another author's characters must be a@complicated matter.

group_1.textRight: Basically, this play is a story you created...
But you took that character from another work?

group_1.textLeft: Many of my masters at work also like those so@called "derivative works."

group_1.textRight: "If it were up to the vampire from "Kirin," how@would she react in this or that scene..."
That's been my thinking process for writing her@lines.

group_1.textLeft: And that's why the dialogue didn't sit right@with you in parts, then.
Since you wouldn't stop worrying whether your@writing was true to the source material.

group_1.textRight: This vampire is evil by nature, but also kind of@enigmatic and has fun at the same time...
I was unsure if those traits could be preserved@in the stage play...
But Nagitan proved my worries unfounded.
Her take on the vampire matched the vision I had@perfectly!
So you don't need to go out of your way to change@your acting!

group_1.textLeft: Certainly, it looks like my laugh back then was@overdoing it.
But as to whether I understand Magical Kirin,@though...
Let's see... I'm not that far into the manga yet...
At least, I'm pretty sure I've yet to get to any@chapters with a vampire in it.

group_1.textRight: That's catastrophical! I'll lend my volumes to@you, so get on reading it! Right! Away!

group_1.textLeft: Doing that would help me understand the character@I'm playing even better, yes?

group_1.textRight: You simply cannot call your life complete until@youâ€™ve read that part!
